member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.ComponentModel.DataLoadController.GetInternalLoader
member.summary: Returns an instance of an automatically created internal loader.
member.remarks: Internal loaders are generally used for unit testing only. It is often useful to override this method to return a different loader. The loader is generally only used to return parameters that may be used during loading. To do so, subclass the default loader (TestEditDataLoader) or implement the IEditDataLoader interface and return it from this method. The controller will then automatically use that loader.

member.name: P:CODE.Framework.Core.ComponentModel.DataLoadController.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters collection (thread-safe)
member.remarks: The dictionary returned by this property is made thread-safe by means of cloning. This means that every time this collection is accessed, a copy of the original (internal) collection is created. If you then interact with the collection, it will not update the original parameters. Therefore, most interaction with this collection should not happen through this property, but by means of the SetParameterValue()/GetParameterValue() methods instead.

member.name: P:CODE.Framework.Core.ComponentModel.TestEditDataLoader.MainDataEntity
member.summary: Reference to the main data entity object
member.remarks: This object typically is the first object in the primary data collection

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.ComponentModel.TestEditDataLoader.SetEntityType``1
member.summary: Sets the main entity type used for auto-loading of content.
member.typeparam: Data entity type
member.remarks: Any object can be set as the main data entity type. However, to perform auto-data-handling, the object must have certain characteristics. New data creation: The type must have a static NewEntity() method (no parameters). Data loading: The type must have a static LoadEntity(Guid) method, -- and/or -- The type must have a static LoadEntity(int) method, -- and/or -- The type must have a static LoadEntity(string) method. Data saving: The type must implement ISavable (and probably should implement IVerifyable) Data verification: The type must implement IVerifyable Data delition: The type must implement IDeletable

member.summary: This method gets called before any data loading starts. This provides the ability to change the UI before the data is loaded (such as showing a wait screen)

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.ComponentModel.IDataHandler.HandleDataException(System.Exception)
member.summary: This method is called whenever an exception is raised during data loading.
member.remarks: It is important to override this method and add code that accepts the error information and funnels it to the foreground thread (since exceptions that occur on background threads will not be visible on the foreground thread and thus not be obvious at all).

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.ComponentModel.IDataHandler.ShowDataException(System.Exception)
member.summary: This method is used to present the data to the user by means of a dialog or something similar.
member.remarks: Generally, this method is called by HandleDataException(ex). It is important to override this method, since otherwise, the exception information will not be displayed to the user. It is IS OK to override this method without calling the default behavior.

member.name: E:CODE.Framework.Core.ComponentModel.IDataHandler.DataExceptionThrown
member.summary: This event fires whenever a data exception (load, save, verify, new,...) is fired.
member.remarks: Generally, this event is fired by HandleDataException(ex).

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.ComponentModel.IEditDataLoader.SetEntityType``1
member.summary: Sets the main entity type used for auto-loading of content.
member.typeparam: Data entity type
member.remarks:
Any object can be set as the main data entity type. However, to perform auto-data-handling, the object must have certain characteristics.
New data creation: The type must have a static NewEntity() method (no parameters).
Data loading: The type must have a static LoadEntity(Guid) method, -- and/or -- The type must have a static LoadEntity(int) method, -- and/or -- The type must have a static LoadEntity(string) method.
Data saving: The type must implement ISavable (and probably should implement IVerifyable)
Data verification: The type must implement IVerifyable
Data delition: The type must implement IDeletable

member.name: P:CODE.Framework.Core.ComponentModel.EditDataLoader.Parameters
member.summary: Parameters collection (thread-safe)
member.remarks: The dictionary returned by this property is made thread-safe by means of cloning. This means that every time this collection is accessed, a copy of the original (internal) collection is created. If you then interact with the collection, it will not update the original parameters. Therefore, most interaction with this collection should not happen through this property, but by means of the SetParameterValue()/GetParameterValue() methods instead.

member.name: T:CODE.Framework.Core.Newtonsoft.DefaultValueHandling
member.summary: Specifies default value handling options for the .

member.name: F:CODE.Framework.Core.Newtonsoft.DefaultValueHandling.Include
member.summary: Include members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects. Included members are written to JSON. Has no effect when deserializing.

member.name: F:CODE.Framework.Core.Newtonsoft.DefaultValueHandling.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects so that is is not written to JSON. This option will ignore all default values (e.g. null for objects and nullable types; 0 for integers, decimals and floating point numbers; and false for booleans). The default value ignored can be changed by placing the on the property.

member.name: F:CODE.Framework.Core.Newtonsoft.DefaultValueHandling.Populate
member.summary: Members with a default value but no JSON will be set to their default value when deserializing.

member.name: F:CODE.Framework.Core.Newtonsoft.DefaultValueHandling.IgnoreAndPopulate
member.summary: Ignore members where the member value is the same as the member's default value when serializing objects and sets members to their default value when deserializing.

member.summary: Read metadata properties located anywhere in a JSON object. Note that this setting will impact performance.

member.param: If set to true the will use a cached shared with other resolvers of the same type. Sharing the cache will significantly improve performance with multiple resolver instances because expensive reflection will only happen once. This setting can cause unexpected behavior if different instances of the resolver are suppose to produce different results. When set to false it is highly recommended to reuse instances with the .

member.name: T:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.MultiXmlFileLogger
member.summary: Logs an event to an XML file.
member.remarks:
Each event is stored into a separate XML file.
Typically, the text passed to the logger is not in XML format. In that case, the logger automatically adds an XML declaration as well as a root tag and a tag for the event content. The name of the root tag is "log" by default, and the event tag is "event" by default. In addition, the event element has a "type" attribute that indicates the type of the logged event. There also is a "timeStamp" attribute that indicates the date and time of the event (GMT). However, all tag/attribute names can be modified by means of the XmlRootNode and XmlEventNode properties.
If the provided text is well formed XML, no other tags are added and the value is used as is, except that the XML declaration may be added or modified. Also the format of the XML may be changed since this logger always creates line feeds and proper tag indentation. No type attribute will be added.

member.summary: Gets or sets the XML root node name.

member.summary: Gets or sets the XML event node name.

member.summary: Gets or sets the XML event type attribute name.

member.summary: Gets or sets the XML event time stamp attribute name.

member.param: The folder the files are to be put into.

member.name: T:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.SingleXmlFileLogger
member.summary: Single XML file logger class
member.remarks:
All events are stored into a common XML file.
Text passed to the logger is not XML formatted. Instead, the text gets logged into an XML file, using the XML file as a database. The text logged is made the content of each "record". If actual XML is passed to the logger, then that XML is simple treated as content that is stored in the log.
The XML log file follows a specific format using a "log" tag as the root element, with "event" tags for each actual event that gets logged. That tag also has "type" and "timeStamp" attributes. All tag and attribute names can be modified through the properties on this object.
The log can be limited to a maximum number of entries. If that number is exceeded, the oldest events get truncated from the log.
The XML file structure has to be compatible with the one defined by this object's properties. If not, the existing XML file is overwritten with a brand new one. (Compatible in this sense means that the root element name has to match. Additional elements that aren't defined by this log object are allowed to exist. They are simply ignored by this logger).

member.summary: Gets or sets the XML root node name.

member.summary: Gets or sets the XML event node name.

For this to work, the provided object must be serializable.

member.name: T:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.SecurityHelper
member.summary: A simple encryption class that can be used to two-encode/decode strings and byte buffers with single method calls.

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.SecurityHelper.EncryptBytes(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encodes a stream of bytes using DES encryption with a pass key. Lowest level method that handles all work.
member.param: Byte array that represents the input string
Encryption key used for the encryption
member.returns: Encrypted bytes

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.SecurityHelper.EncryptBytes(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encrypts a string into bytes using DES encryption with a Passkey.
member.returns: Encrypted bytes

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.SecurityHelper.EncryptString(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Encrypts a string using Triple DES encryption with a two way encryption key. String is returned as Base64 encoded value rather than binary.
member.returns: Base64 encoded encrypted string
member.remarks: The key is expected to have a length of 24 bytes. This method can be used with an arbitrary key, but make sure you use the same key for encryption and decryption.

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.SecurityHelper.DecryptBytes(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decrypts a Byte array from DES with an Encryption Key.
member.returns: Decrypted bytes

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.SecurityHelper.DecryptBytes(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decrypts a string
member.returns: Decrypted bytes

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.SecurityHelper.DecryptString(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Decrypts a Base64 encoded string using DES encryption and a pass key that was used for encryption.
member.returns: Decrypted string
member.remarks: The key is expected to have a length of 24 bytes. This method can be used with an arbitrary key, but make sure you use the same key for encryption and decryption.

member.name: T:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.StringHelper

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.StringHelper.Proper(System.String)
member.summary: Receives a string as a parameter and returns the string in Proper format (makes each letter after a space capital)
member.example: StringHelper.Proper("joe doe is a good man"); //returns "Joe Doe Is A Good Man"
member.returns: Proper string

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.StringHelper.SmartProper(System.String)
member.summary: This method returns strings in proper case. However, contrary to regular Proper() methods, this method can be used to format names. For instance, "MacLeod" will remain "MacLeod", "macLeod" will be "MacLeod", "MACLEOD" will be turned into "Macleod". "macleod" will also be turned into "Macleod".
member.param: String that is to be formatted
member.returns: Properly formatted string

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.StringHelper.SpaceCamelCase(System.String)
member.summary: This method takes a camel-case string (such as one defined by an enum) and returns is with a space before every upper-case letter.
member.returns: String with spaces

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.StringHelper.ToFile(System.String,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Receives a string and a file name as parameters and writes the contents of the string to that file
member.example: string text = "This is the line we want to insert in our file."; StringHelper.ToFile(text, "c:\\My Folders\\MyFile.txt");
member.param: File name the string is to be written to.

member.name: M:CODE.Framework.Core.Utilities.StringHelper.FromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a file from disk and returns it as a string
member.returns: String containing the file contents

member.summary: Indicates whether the volume should be trimmed from fully qualified paths

member.remarks: when this is set, we trim the volume (eg C:) off any fully-qualified pathname, before writing the ZipEntry into the ZipFile. We default this to true. This allows Windows Explorer to read the zip archives properly.
